title: Ars Live: How Profitable is Starlink? Join our discussion today!

title: Stoke Space ignites its ambitious main engine for the first time

title: Stoke Space test-fires new booster engine
summary: Stoke Space has test-fired a highly efficient engine it is developing for the first stage of its fully reusable launch vehicle.

title: Kepler demonstrates optical data relay service in LEO
summary: Kepler Communications has successfully tested optical inter-satellite links between a pair of data relay prototypes in low Earth orbit, the Canadian operator announced June 11.

title: China selects new batch of astronauts with an eye on the moon
summary: China’s human spaceflight agency announced the selection of 10 new astronauts Tuesday, aiming to bolster its spaceflight capabilities for future missions, including potential crewed lunar landings.

title: Launch Roundup: Falcon 9’s busy launch cadence continues
summary: Following an extremely eventful week in Spaceflight, this coming week returns to “business as usual.” Two SpaceX Starlink missions, one each from Vandenberg and Florida, and a Falcon 9 launching a customer satellite make up the launches for the week.

title: New direct-to-cell satellite tech could disrupt billion-dollar military satcom programs
summary: Col. Eric Felt:  Direct-to-cell services conceivably could enhance or replace dedicated narrowband satcom systems like the Mobile User Objective System (MUOS)
